Summary: Two bright lights disappeared behind cloud cover.
divs: sighting detailsreport written by mufon s.t.a.r. field investigator *(wit's name deleted--cms\sg) virginia (witness). at around 06:12 am in the morning, i was sitting in my vehicle at a worksite located at a new high school building that was being built in berryville, va, a few miles off route 7. i was parked facing east as i was watching the sky change color from the sunrise. then my attention was drawn to a bright, white light that appeared right above a dark elongated cloud. strangely, i also noticed that the light���s trajectory did not behave as to a plane���s takeoff light, the flight pattern was vertical. the light soon disappeared behind the cloud ribbon but oddly enough, it did not emerge above it ��� [see a on diagram]. about a minute later, i saw what seems to be another white light moving upward but slightly to the left of the first sighting and it also vanished behind a cloud ��� [see b]. these lights were slightly larger and brighter in comparison to what i believe to be the planet venus that was positioned e\se above the horizon. each sighting lasted about 5 to 6 seconds prior losing them behind cloud cover. investigator���s notes: airliners' white takeoff lights should have been turned off at that altitude and even if these planes were facing me (westerly flight-path) they would have eventually flown at an angle or over my area. no other navigational strobes or beacons were detected. dulles international airport is approximately 30 miles e and a smaller airport, leesburg executive airport is about 18 miles from where i was parked. [weather] 25 ���f average humidity: 54 wind speed: 3.5 mph (north) visibility: 10 miles, partly cloudy
